Member Function Documentation

void mc_dbms_database::close (  dbms_boolean  clean = 1  ) 
 

This closes the peresistent database file. It is at this point that data is written to the persistent store. If the clean flag is not 0 then it indicates that an error has occurred. This functoin will only write data to the persistent store if the clean flag is set to 1 (which is the default).

Parameters:
clean A value of 0 indicates that this is not a clean shutdown (an error occurred during processing). Any other value indicate that this is a clean shutdown and data should be written to the persistent store.

mc_dbms_database_root* mc_dbms_database::create_root (  dbms_const_char_ptr  name_arg  ) 
 

This creates a root for the database. A root is defined as an entry-point for iterations.

Parameters:
name_arg The name of the root.
Returns:
A pointer to the new root.

mc_dbms_segment* mc_dbms_database::create_segment (   ) 
 

This creates a new segment.

Returns:
The pointer to the new segment.

mc_dbms_database_root* mc_dbms_database::find_root (  dbms_const_char_ptr  name_arg  )  const
 

This finds a root in the database.

Parameters:
name_arg The name of the root to find.
Returns:
A pointer to the root. It is 0 if the root is not found

int mc_dbms_database::get_n_roots (   )  [inline]
 

This returns the number of roots in this database.

Returns:
The number of roots associated with this database.

This returns the persistent database.

The persistent database.

This returns the transient database.

The transient database.

dbms_boolean mc_dbms_database::is_transient_database (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
Return true if this is a transient database and false if it is not.

static mc_dbms_database* mc_dbms_database::of (  void const *  location  )  [inline, static]
 

This returns the database the passed-in variable is in. However, in our case, this can only be the persistent database, so this function always simply returns a pointer to our persistent database.

Parameters:
location The pointer for whom the database should be returned.
Returns:
The database the pointer is in.

static mc_dbms_database* mc_dbms_database::open (  dbms_const_char_ptr  pathname,
dbms_boolean  read_only = 0,
dbms_int32  create_mode = 0,
int  new_segment_reference_policy = 0
)  [static]
 

This opens the persistent database. All parameters are ignored. In mc_dbms we only ever deal with one database (the persistent store). Therefore this function always opens it and returns a pointer to opened database.

Parameters:
pathname The name of the database. (not used)
read_only The database to read-only. (not used)
create_mode The database if it is not found. (not used)
new_segment_reference_policy Policy on how to handle new segments. (not used)
Returns:
A pointer to the open database.

static void mc_dbms_database::set_dumpInstanceData (  bool  dumpFlag = true  )  [inline, static]
 

This routime sets the flag that determines if we will dump a report about the Instance data we are tracking when the database gets closed. By default a report will not be written-out.

Parameters:
dumpFlag Set this to true (which is default) to cause a report to be printed and false to not print a report.

static void mc_dbms_database::set_persistence (  const std::string &  fullyQualifiedFileName = ""  )  [inline, static]
 

This routine sets a filename that we should attempt to persist the database to. By default, this value is empty, and the persistence operation will NOT occur. When a file name is specified, an attempt will be made to open the specifed file (any existing contents will be truncated) and data from the InstanceContainer will be written-out to this file. If an error occurs opening or writting to this file an exeption will be thrown.

Parameters:
fullyQualifiedFileName Fully qualified name of the file to persist to.

static void mc_dbms_database::set_restore (  const std::string &  fullyQualifiedFileName = ""  )  [inline, static]
 

This routine sets a filename that we should attempt to load the database from. By default, this value is empty, and no restore will be attempted. When a file name is specified, an attempt will be made to restore from the specified file. If the file does not exist an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
fullyQualifiedFileName Fully qualified name of the file to restore from.

Member Data Documentation

bool mc_dbms_database::m_dumpInstanceData [static, private]
 

bool mc_dbms_database::m_isOpen [private]
 

This flag is only used by the persistent store. It is used to indicate if the open() method has been successfuly called on this persistent store yet or not.
